book_name: CAE Oxford Human Performance and Limitations

questions.question: How is oxygen transported around the body?
options: a. By red blood cells combined with carbon dioxide
b. By red blood cells combined with nitrogen and water vapour
c. By red blood cells combined with haemoglobin
d. By red blood cells combined with nitrogen, hormones and plasma

questions.question: How is the rate and depth of breathing controlled?
options: a. By the amount of oxyhaemoglobin in the blood and lungs
b. By the amount of haemoglobin in the blood and the lungs
c. By the amount of carbon monoxide and oxygen in the blood
d. By the amount of carbonic acid in the blood

questions.question: What is the function of the left and right ventricle?
options: a. Left: Pumps deoxygenated blood to the lungs Right: Pumps oxygenated blood around the body
b. Left: Pumps oxygenated blood around the body Right: Pumps deoxygenated blood to the lungs
c. Left: Pumps oxygenated blood to the lungs Right: Pumps deoxygenated blood around the body
d. Left: Pumps oxygenated blood to the lungs Right: Pumps oxygenated blood around the body

questions.question: The factor which most increases the risk of coronary heart disease is:
options: a. family history
b. lack of exercise
c. obesity
d. smoking

questions.question: What is the carcinogenic content of a cigarette?
options: a. Nicotine
b. Tar
c. The type of tobacco
d. The wrapping

questions.question: Angina is a pain associated with the heart which is felt only across the chest. This statement is:
options: a. true
b. untrue

questions.question: List the symptoms of carbon monoxide poisoning:
options: a. difficulty in breathing, ruddy complexion, headache, stomach cramps, nausea,
b. ruddy complexion, headache, stomach cramps, nausea, lethargy
c. ruddy complexion, headache, nausea, giddiness, stomach cramps
d. ruddy complexion, headache, tightness across the forehead, impaired judgement

questions.question: Why is it essential to ensure that the combustion heaters are serviceable?
options: a. To prevent carbon dioxide poisoning and possible fire
b. To prevent carbon dioxide poisoning, possible fire or explosion
c. To prevent carbon monoxide poisoning
d. To prevent carbon dioxide poisoning and possible fire

questions.question: The effects of smoking, particularly in relation to aviation are:
options: a. an early onset of hypoxia due to an apparent increase in altitude and a degradation of night vision
b. an early onset of hypoxia due to an apparent increase in altitude
c. an early onset of hypoxia due to an apparent increase in altitude up to a maximum of 40000 ft
d. an early onset of hypoxia due to an apparent increase in altitude with a resulting risk of anaemia

questions.question: Will smokers experience hypoxia at a lower or higher cabin altitude than non-smokers?
options: a. At a higher cabin altitude
b. At a lower cabin altitude
c. Both will experience hypoxia at approximately the same cabin altitude
d. Smoking, although harmful in other ways, lessens the effects of hypoxia

questions.question: A pilot must wait at least 24 hours before flying after donating blood.
options: a. True
b. False

questions.question: Where does the exchange of oxygen and carbon dioxide + water vapour take place:
options: a. the arteries
b. the veins
c. the capillaries
d. the pulmonary veins and arteries

questions.question: The normal range of blood pressure is:
options: a. systolic 120 mm Hg and diastolic 80 mm Hg
b. systolic 80 mm Hg and diastolic 120 mm Hg
c. systolic 120 mm Hg and diastolic 120 mm Hg
d. systolic 80 mm Hg and diastolic 80 mm Hg

questions.question: Pressoreceptors affect the:
options: a. ECG readings
b. tightening and relaxation of the blood vessels only
c. EEG readings
d. tightening and relaxation of the blood vessels and the pulse rate

questions.question: Hypotension is:
options: a. high blood pressure
b. high pulse rate
c. low blood pressure
d. low pulse rate

questions.question: Haemoglobin has a preference to carbon monoxide over oxygen by a factor of:
Treatment of carbon monoxide poisoning should include:
options: a. immediate descent to MSA
b. turn up cabin heat
c. keep the patient's body temperature as low as possible
d. stop all smoking

questions.question: Low blood pressure can lead to:
options: a. low body temperature
b. reduced tolerance to g-forces
c. infarct
d. angina

questions.question: Cardiac output (the quantity of blood pumped by the heart per unit time), is the product of:
options: a. stroke volume and the heart rate (pulse rate)
b. stroke volume and viscosity of the blood
c. pulse rate and strength of the ventricle muscle
d. pulse rate only

questions.question: Internal Respiration is:
options: a. the brain's control of the pulse rate
b. the exchange of oxygen with carbon dioxide and water in the cells
c. sighing
d. the retention of breath
